ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ A Democrat wrote this letter to Mark Halperin after Trump's speech. A must read for all Americans. 

Hi Mark,

I watched the speech last night. Iâ€™m a Democrat, my immediate family and siblings are Democrats. We didnâ€™t vote for Trump.

Last night for me was my breaking point. I watched with my husband as fellow Democrats (ironically wearing pink for women) sat there either stone-faced or seething with disgust while the family of Laken Riley was honored and a young boy with cancer became an honorary secret service agent. 

Iâ€™m switching parties. Itâ€™s been coming for awhile, but that was the moment for me.

I have a young family member that was the victim of assault, I have family in law enforcement, we have all been touched in some way by cancer, and I have not been able to come to terms with what I witnessed from Democrats last night. 

It was surreal. It was like an episode of Scooby Doo where they pull off the masks and show you who the villains are. I literally couldnâ€™t sleep last night. I canâ€™t believe Iâ€™m saying this. But Iâ€™m done. As a woman, a mother, as a HUMAN, Iâ€™m just done. When I heard Nicole Wallaceâ€™s heinous remark I said to my husband â€œwho are these people?!â€

They donâ€™t represent me anymore, or who I am. I can finally admit to myself that despite my personal dislike of Trump, I begrudgingly admit I support some of what he is actually doing. I canâ€™t think of much I support that the Democrats have been doing for a long time, and frankly I donâ€™t even know what they stand for now except the right to choose (which is no longer enough) and men having the right to invade what were once my personal spaces.

I admitâ€¦ I actually smiled when I saw the First Lady. I cried when the boy hugged the secret service agent. I realized I have so missed this quintessentially American feeling of pride. Pride for my fellow citizens, pride for my country. Iâ€™m flabbergasted at myself but it feels like a relief to admit all of this. I canâ€™t say Iâ€™m MAGAâ€¦. but I know now after last night I am no longer a Democrat.

Best, 
REDACTED
